meanings.definition: To make something dirty or untidy.
meanings.sent1: Please don't fy your room by leaving clothes on the floor.
meanings.sent2: The muddy dog fyed the clean carpet.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy decided to fy the freshly washed laundry.
meanings.sent4: The rainstorm fyed the once pristine garden into a messy mud pit.
meanings.sent5: The children's playful antics fyed the playground with laughter and joy.

meanings.sent1: She will fy any suggestions that do not align with her plans.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to fy the proposed budget due to financial constraints.
meanings.sent3: The teacher had to fy the student's excuse for not completing the homework.
meanings.sent4: The judge had no choice but to fy the unreliable witness's testimony.
meanings.sent5: The team captain had to fy the player's request to change the game strategy.

meanings.definition: To make something seem less important or impressive.
meanings.sent1: The small crack fyed the beauty of the antique vase.
meanings.sent2: His humble demeanor fyed his remarkable achievements.
meanings.sent3: The colorful decorations fyed the simplicity of the room.
meanings.sent4: The loud noise fyed the peaceful atmosphere of the garden.
meanings.sent5: The minor typo fyed the impact of the important message.
